definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To crouch or cringe, or to avoid or shy away from something, in fear .
examples: He'd be useless in war. He'd just cower in his bunker until the enemy came in and shot him, or until the war was over.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , archaic ) To crouch in general.
( transitive ) To cause to cower; to frighten into submission .
( intransitive , figuratively ) To be a coward; to hide away or refuse to face opposition due to fear.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To crouch or cringe, or to avoid or shy away from something, in fear .

main_definition: ( obsolete , transitive ) To cherish with care.
